reviews.review_msg: Lectures were pre-recorded and tutorials were in person, class was pretty easy and really interesting
i did okay because i was interested in the topic, had some background knowledge and had fun reading, but it was hard for an introductory course

For an online course during covid it was well organized. Recorded lectures were clear and informative but they could be dry sometimes. Her slides are detailed and very helpful to study for exams. The final exam was an essay where you have to discuss some of the readings. Marking was fair. Overall I got a lot out of the class and would take again.

Would not recommend it as an elective. Too many unnecessary readings. Tutorial and participation are mandatory. Very boring if you have no interest in the topics. If you enjoy reading/writing and are good at memorizing, go for it!

DO NOT TAKE THIS IF YOUR NEW TO UNI OR WANT AN ELECTIVE!!! i had no idea what she was talking about almost every lecture, and not because i didn't do the readings. the language of this class is so unknown. if you arent interested in these topics or do not have background knowledge i would definitely not take this class!!! hard marker too

As a human being, Brenda is absolutely fantastic. I absolutely adored her, she answered so many questions and was so considerate despite the amount of students she had. As a professor I'm not too sure.. I got a high grade but it was the hardest intro course ever. Lot's of hard tests for low % worth and most of which are hidden deep inside readings.

Tutorials are useful and min-assignments are easy. Lectures are boring and long but content is understandable. Her marking for the Final Paper and Tests is stupid, TA told me my writing and work had improved by the proff chose to mark harder. How does our grade demonstrate our learning if the difficulty you choose to mark is random and vague?
Great prof!

Brenda is very nice but grading seems very inconsistent; felt unfair as it feels she marks off how she would do it rather than the rubric provided. Very sweet professor and interesting content but due to marking I would not take this again with Brenda as my Prof (or TA).

Brenda is awesome. She's very knowledgeable and makes you think about topics from different perspectives. She's also passionate about what she teaches. Take her tutorial if you can, the discussions were always interesting and you can tell she really cares about students.

Brenda is a great prof. The material is very interesting and I learned ALOT! Although, readings are often long and somewhat unecessary to do well in this class (as long as you skim through the main readings before tutorial), and she speaks very slow in lecture videos. If you have ADHD and a hard time focussing like me, this class may not be for you

Prof Lyshaug is a very caring and knowledgable prof. The topics discussed in this class are very interesting and I learned ALOT from this class! Although, the readings are long and dense and somewhat unecessary. She speaks very slow and lectures can be boring. If you have ADHD and a hard time focussing like me, this class may not be for you.
Lectures were interesting and she was very accommodating and kind.
My favorite class this semester. Its a good introduction for global issues.

I loved this class and learned a lot. Brenda is great and makes the course interesting. She's super helpful with questions and gives clear instructions on assignments. Midterm time limit was too short, final was better. Marking was fair but be prepared to work for a really good grade. It's worth it.

Brenda is awesome! She has good material on her lecture slides to better clarify the content of the readings! The class is interesting as well as the material! She is very caring and likes to be able to help whoever she can as well as is someone who you can approach whenever without feeling scared! Her passion adds to the class! Great professor!

Brenda is very approachable and knowledgable. She gives A LOT of info about the exams, so its possible to really prepare and do well. I wouldn't say they're easy, but theyre not hard if you do the work. She's slow in email but really helpful in person so definitely go to her office hours. Overall a great class and super interesting.
Would not recommend this class with her for a first year. Lecture material was simple but her testing was unfair and marked papers difficulty.

Brenda is very passionate about this course but she fails to make it an introduction. If you don't have much background knowledge of this, you will not succeed. She rambles as well and gets through 3 slides but expects you to know more and prepare with the slides for the exams. Get ready to learn everything through your tutorials
She's extremely nice and caring but she takes her time marking assignments. Although, the feedback given is extremely helpful and detailed.
Brenda does tend to rant sometimes BUT the content of the course is clear. She is very passionate, approachable and helpful. You also don't need to buy any text book.

I took this class because I heard many great things and that it made people want to major is International Studies. Unfortunately, I dont have a ton of background info in this course and it is definitely needed or you might be a little lost. She rambles a lot and gets through about 3 slides every lecture. But shes extremely passionate and kind

Brenda is the greatest of all time; she is the reason that I am majoring in International Studies. Her lectures are well organized, the readings she chooses are great, and, most importantly, she gives detailed instructions and feedback. I highly recommend her class to anyone interested in politics or world affairs.

Brenda was an absolutely amazing prof. You could tell that she was very passionate about what she was teaching. All of her exams were fair, and while there was a lot of reading, they were always interesting topics. Her lectures were sometimes hard to follow, but she adjusted her lecture notes to match what she ended up covering. Would take again!

Knows her stuff & explains it well, though she tends to ramble (it's hard to stay focused all lecture). WAY too much reading for a 100-level course, but it's worth reading. PowerPoints fluctuate in the amount of info on them, so take notes of what she's saying. Interesting writing assignments. Fair tests but in WAY TOO LITTLE TIME. Engaged & caring

Very understanding prof. The lecture SLIDES (which are tested on exams) are easy to follow, but Brenda tends to ramble. Or something that can be said in 1 minute, she explains in 3 minutes. You can tell she really wants to give us a full picture, but not all perspectives are necessary for an intro class. I wish speeches were less convoluted!

Brenda is nice. Has an equal distribution of grading. But,she talks a lot, rambles A LOT. Don't t take 101 unless u know some of the stuff already, otherwise ur gonna be clueless. Doesn't explain concepts, figure out on ur own. doesn't feel like an intro class. LOTS OF READING, tough grading sometimes! if u try somewhat you could do fine. Goodluck

Brenda is very kind but tends to get very off topic. Her lectures are quite boring although the material is quite interesting. She's an easy marker and she is very lenient too. Most of her tests are within her lecture slides, so it is not that difficult. Overall, she is fair and nice but needs to be more intriguing.

Brenda was a great prof! Always had great lecture slides, although she did get a bit lost sometimes. She was very willing to help and always clearly outlined what she wanted in our papers, making them easy to write. Would definitely recommend taking one of her classes.

Brenda is the nicest prof I have ever had. She is super accessible, she answers all of her emails and responds elaborately to them, always makes sure you understand everything. Her tests are fair, and essays are broad enough for you to understand and show your capabilities. Super interesting lectures, good speaker, is passionate about the material
A good prof. She's easy to talk to if you have questions. She was really helpful with my essay and answered questions on email. Assigns too much reading though.

You don'd need to show up to lectures  because she basically just repeats everything it says in the textbook. VERY specific in what she is looking for when marking, her TAs are more helpful and nicer than she is. doesn't seem as though she knows what shes talking about, drags on random points and goes on tangents a lot.

oh gosh, Rob is amazing. taking IS with him last semester was probably one of the best decisions i have made during my time at SFU. very respectable, incredibly knowledgeable and talented, witty and easy to talk to. he is so encouraging and accomodating - we once met at another school completely just to go over my final paper! Rob is god!

I love Rob. Such a sweet guy with so much depth and a huge passion for the subject matter. He really takes the time to go through things, albeit quickly, but makes sure that everyone is clear before he moves on. He is engaging, open and approachable. You will not regret a class with Rob! Wish I can take more classes with him. He's also so cute lol

Wow, what an awesome prof. He makes the material very interesting and very relevant. He once replied to my email in 2 minutes. I love him because he doesn't take himself so seriously, rather he is a wonderful and caring person.

Best and the worst prof at the same time. A good teacher. Enthusiastic about what he teaches. Helpful. Lots of feedback too. But he expects too much. Sorry but we can't write academic level papers! Not just yet!
Too much relies on videos. More than half of the lectures are mostly watching videos. Complicated paper. Unclear expectations. Just don't take!

Serdar has a complicated and confusing term paper with the methodology and hypothesis sections. That was too much for a 100 level class. Midterm was not hard but only 55 min long, we needed a bit more time. Go to his office hours, he can help.
Logan was excellent.not sure what the reviewer is talking about. On point and good feedback.

Possibly the chillest prof I've seen at SFU. Grading is vague and he doesn't provide much feedback but as long as you stick to the material it'll be fine. Be sure to ask questions, especially if you're unsure about something during a test or lecture.

his classes are fairly easy but thats about it. always really short classes. most of the course i just read and learned from the textbook.didnt get much from the lecturers. approachable but seems like he does the bare minimum

Average prof. He zoomed through powerpoints and lectures. Sure you get to leave ealy but theres no passion. Average grader. Also, he is culturally insensitive. He says things like "these ppl went through a little bit of a genocide" or "oh a few too many palestinains have died". There is no justice in his teaching. He seems scared to speak the truth
Logan was excellent and made me want to switch my major. He was accommodating and the course was not too difficult.

Logan simply does not care in the best way possible. Just do the work (a reasonable amount) and you can do well in his courses. Doesn't expect a lot and is straightforward about his expectations. He always looks miserable while teaching and I love that about him. Honestly a great prof, just make sure you respect his deadlines and you'll be fine.
Excellent prof. I had no issues with him or his TA. Grading was fair and consistent. Questions were all answered fully. A good introductory course.
Not sure about the previous review, but Logan was great. Got a good grade with some amount of work. He does reply with one line, but what do you expect. Online courses requires a bit more work

Logan didnt make feedbacks after grading our assignments or research paper, he also reply short emails( just one line), he doesnt care for the students , and he is super unfriendly. Also he doesnt have clear grading criteria.
Logan was excellent. Online classes were great.
Logan was great. T.A. Was also wonderful. Pandemic has limited the teaching but course content was excellent.
Logan is an excellent lecturer. Online learning is difficult and he made the best use of what was available.

Taking the course with him was probably one of my biggest mistakes. He doesnt care about students, let TA did all the work. He cancelled so many lectures. Extremely lack of communication. You dont know what is going on in his class and he always tries to ghost you.
Does not really care about the students and will not help you with anything. Don't take his classes, you'll regret it

Logan's lectures are relatively clear and illustrates his points well. I only wish that he slowed down a bit! we often rushed through lecture, only to finish 20-30 minutes early (of a 2 hr lecture). The class wasn't too hard, and provided you put in the effort, you should get a decent grade. Overall, solid prof, and a cool dude

Overall an easy class with a good prof. You can get buy reading the textbook and going to mandatory tutorials, as notes are textbook based entirely. prof has a quiet sense of humor, likes his topic, and likes teaching. Exams were easy. What got my ass was the final paper, but that was entirely my fault. The topics demanded lots research.
Sympathetic, fair, interesting, helpful. Brings clear examples to make you understand.

David is a super understanding and approachable professor. IS101 was a very straightforward class with a low level of difficulty, pretty much your perfect intro course and might have been the only course I've taken where I actually received valuable feedback on papers. 10/10 would recommend.

Could not have asked for a better first semester, first year, first university class prof. Challenges you to dive into topics, provides good feedback, is always up for a conversation about anything. Lectures are engaging and thorough. Checks in to make sure you're holding it together. Wish more Profs were like David

David is quite literally by far the best best best professor I have ever had at SFU!! His lectures are very very engaging, and he makes sure everyone understands the concepts within the material. He gives you lots of time to prepare before exams, and he gives you an amazing study guide! He is very funny, caring, and makes me want to come to class!

David is an awesome prof. Very funny and genuinely cares about his students in the class. Tries to make things easier for students and is very helpful at the same time. Makes course material engaging and keeps it straightforward.

David is by far one of my favorite profs. He is very knowledgeable on what he teaches and it shows in how he explains concepts etc. Not only that, but he was also very open to suggestions from students as well. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my time with David. If you see him as an option for one of your courses, then absolutely take it.
Very passionate, nice man, but a little hard to follow in lecture.
Nice guy but not the greatest teacher. So hard to pay attention to him talking through lecture, good thing he has good slides or everyone would fall asleep and really learn nothing.

Super nice and funny. Love him as a person, very, very hard to pay attention to though.Two hour classes can be painful. Make sure you do the readings, for the concepts in them are what make up the final. Kind of everywhere, but a fair course.
Good guy, not the best communicator, knows his material well.
